page.title: 11THE CHURCH
page.content: On the rebuilding of the church, the nave was restored. The chief interest now lies in the 13th century tower.Churches of this early period were often built for emergencies. The parish church was the parish castle if the village was attacked. Previous to the rebuilding of the church, in 1863, was a solidly built structure of about 23 ft in height with a pyramical roof. The only windows were 2 slits. Communication between the church and tower is a small 13th century archway, the garrison could retire to the tower and barricade this entrance. A narrow slit was widened to be used by archers.
